docs/attestors/commandrun.title: Command Attestor
docs/attestors/commandrun.description: The Command Attestor collects information about a command that TestifySec Witness executes and observes.

docs/attestors/environment.title: Environment Attestor
docs/attestors/environment.description: The Environment Attestor records the OS, hostname, username, and all environment variables set

docs/attestors/gcp-iit.description: The Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Instance Identity Attestor communicates with the GCP metadata server to collect information

docs/attestors/git.title: Git Attestor
docs/attestors/git.description: The Git Attestor records the current state of the objects in the git repository, including untracked objects.

docs/attestors/gitlab.title: GitLab Attestor
docs/attestors/gitlab.description: The GitLab Attestor records information about the GitLab CI/CD job execution in which

docs/attestors/jwt.title: JWT Attestor
docs/attestors/jwt.description: The JWT (JSON Web Token) Attestor verifies a JWT against a JWKS (JSON Web Key Set) and records information about the

docs/attestors/material.title: Material Attestor
docs/attestors/material.description: The Material Attestor records the digests of all files in the working directory of TestifySec Witness

docs/attestors/maven.title: Maven Attestor
docs/attestors/maven.description: The Maven Attestor records project and dependency information from a provided pom.xml (Maven Project Object Model).

docs/attestors/oci.title: OCI Attestor
docs/attestors/oci.description: The OCI Attestor records information about a provided Open Container Initiative (OCI) image stored on disk as a tarball.

docs/commands.title: Witness CLI Reference
docs/commands.description: This is the reference for the Witness command line tool, generated by Cobra.

docs/concepts/attestor.title: Attestors
docs/concepts/attestor.description: A Witness attestor is a programming interface that defines an object that can assert facts about a system and store those facts in a versioned schema. An attestor has a Name, Type and RunType. The Type is a versioned string corresponding to the JSON schema of the attestation. For example, the AWS attestor is defined as follows:

docs/concepts/config.title: Configuration
docs/concepts/config.description: Witness allows the user to specify a yaml file for persisting the command line flags to be set whenever Witness is invoked. Any values in the configuration file will be overridden by the command line flags set on command invocation.

docs/signers/kms.title: KMS Signer
docs/signers/kms.description: Witness supports signing both attestations (generated with witness run) and policies (signed with witness sign) using a Key Management Service (KMS) key through the provision of a KMS signer. The KMS signer currently supports AWS KMS and GCP KMS. Follow-up support for Azure Key Vault and HashiCorp Vault (with transit engine) is planned.
